messages.subject: Re: FW: [UnschoolingDiscussion] movies with nuns
messages.msgSnippet: ... I didn t get asked THAT many times.  I d say You know...   that movie... and if they d guess I d act like yeah! That one!    (But I d always fess up
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/30/05 9:04:52 AM, dezigna@... writes:


> <<<<<Try www.imdb.com and type in nuns in the plot keyword search.>>>>
>
> I discovered you get a whole lot more results if you just type in the single
> "nun".
>

I didn't get asked THAT many times. <g>
I'd say "You know... that movie..." and if they'd guess I'd act like yeah!
That one! (But I'd always fess up to being a generic nun.)

Someone came in and said "Are you Whoopi Goldberg?" and I said "Yes I am."

One girl was dressed as Princess Lea in the gold bikini at Jabba's place, and
Holly pointed at her and at me and said "Two Carrie Fishers!" (they were
looking for pairs and sets, and Carrie Fisher played a nun in Jay and Silent Bob
Strike Back).

I was agreeable to anyone's good theory. <G>

There were lots of people; 40 maybe overall. Everyone was in costume but
three adults (Keith got back from work really late and was our shopper/gofer for
outings, and hid out elsetime, and another couple came by after work for a
while). The one person who had truly resisted wearing a costume came as the
John Belushi character from Animal House, in toga and laurel. GOOD costume,
and he wore it all night without self-consciousness. One set of twins I
hadn't met before, tall and 18 or so, were Darth Maul (excellent make-up--looked
like he had shaved his head and glued on spikes, but it was a bald wig/spike
head put on really well) and Obi-Wan (the middle-aged Obi-Wan, not the young or
old one <g>). Good way to be a set without looking at ALL alike.

Some photos are linked from the Kirby page and there will be more later.
http://sandradodd.com/kirby

I got tired of messing with them, but there will be more. There's only one
of me, and it's Very Bad. Maybe...

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Robyn L. Coburn
